content.title: Main Entrance
content.content: The main thoroughfare into the college.  Kind of understated, don't you think?

content.title: The Rice sign
content.content: This lets people know which college they are at.  Rice students are smart but often need guidance.

content.title: William Rice
content.content: Opened in 1912 after the murder of its namesake William Marsh Rice, Rice is a research university with an undergraduate focus. Its emphasis on education is demonstrated by a small student body and 6:1 student-faculty ratio. Rice is noted for its applied science programs in the fields of artificial heart research, structural chemical analysis, signal processing, space science, and nanotechnology. In 2010, it was ranked first in the world in materials science research.

content.title: The Archway
content.content: There it is...you just went through it, so you know everything I know about it.

content.title: Valhalla
content.content: A snazzy student bar tucked away in the middle of campus.  In theory its only for graduate students.

content.title: The Student Union
content.content: A stage and many dining and shopping options for the students.

content.title: McNair Hall
content.content: Also the shell auditorium and central garage

content.title: Baker Hall
content.content: James A. Baker the third once had a hall named after him.  Take that James Baker Jr...what did you accomplish?

content.title: The Skyspace
content.content: James Turrell's "Twilight Epiphany" Skyspace.  It was built in a sudden realization of the greatness of sparkly vampires.

content.title: The Stadium
content.content: This concludes the tour.  Thank you for your time.  PLease send hundreds of thousands of dollars and your firstborn child.

content.title: A waterfall
content.content: Such a nice waterfall i could stay here all day
